In village or in forest,

the one with a burning, dark path,
The birds are born there,
as the days and nights pass.
But when a monk endowed with virtue

translated: in the same way has Master Gotama — through many lines of reasoning — made the Dhamma clear.

analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ yena bhagavā tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala went to the Blessed One and, on arrival, having bowed down to him, sat to one side. As he was sitting there, he said to the Blessed One,

original: “Tayo kho, mahārāja, purisassa dhammā ajjhattaṁ uppajjamānā uppajjanti ahitāya dukkhāya aphāsuvihārāya.
analyzed: tayaḥ kho mahā rāja purisassa dhammā ajjhattam uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti ahitāya dukkhāya a phāsu vihārāya
translated: “Great king, three things, when arising in the heart, arise for the harm, sorrow, & difficulty of an individual.

original: Katame tayo?🔽Lobho kho, mahārāja, purisassa dhammo ajjhattaṁ uppajjamāno uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya aphāsuvihārāya.
analyzed: katame tayaḥ  lobhaḥ kho mahā rāja purisassa dhammaḥ ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya a phāsu vihārāya
translated: Which three?🔽Greed, when arising in the heart, arises for the harm, sorrow, & difficulty of an individual.

original: Doso kho, mahārāja, purisassa dhammo ajjhattaṁ uppajjamāno uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya aphāsuvihārāya.
analyzed: dosaḥ kho mahā rāja purisassa dhammaḥ ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya a phāsu vihārāya
translated: Aversion, when arising in the heart, arises for the harm, sorrow, & difficulty of an individual.

original: Moho kho, mahārāja, purisassa dhammo ajjhattaṁ uppajjamāno uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya aphāsuvihārāya.🔽Ime kho, mahārāja, tayo purisassa dhammā ajjhattaṁ uppajjamānā uppajjanti ahitāya dukkhāya aphāsuvihārāyā”ti.
analyzed: mohaḥ kho mahā rāja purisassa dhammaḥ ajjhattam uppajjamānaḥ uppajjati ahitāya dukkhāya a phāsu vihārāya  ime kho mahā rāja tayo purisassa dhammā ajjhattam uppajjamānāḥ uppajjanti ahitāya dukkhāya a phāsu vihārāya ati
translated: Delusion, when it arises in a person, arises for his harm, for his pain, for his distress.🔽These three things, when they arise in a person, arise for his harm, for his pain, for his distress.”
This is what the Blessed One said. Having said this, the Fortunate One, the Teacher, further said this:
“Greed, hatred, and delusion,
a person with evil mind,
harm themselves, as if cut by a sword,
as if struck by a weapon.”
Saṁyutta Nikāya 56.1

With King Pasenadi
At Sāvatthī.

translated: even those great householder clans that are rich, of great wealth, of great possessions, of great riches, of great authority, of great influence, even their births do not go beyond death.

That is, with ignorance as condition, there are fabrications. With fabrications as condition, there is consciousness. With consciousness as condition, there is name-&-form. With birth as condition, aging-&-death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, distress, and despair come to be.🔽Such is the origination of this entire mass of stress & suffering.
